awd_titl_txt: Diatom Paleoceanography of the Equatorial Atlantic, 1.7-3.6 Million Years B.P.
awd_abstract_narration: The study will aim to reconstruct surface ocean changes in                 the equatorial Atlantic of the past 2 m. yrs. using diatoms                     assemblages in cores from ODP Site 662. Diatoms are sensitive                   recorders of productivity and surface circulation conditions.                   The investigators hope to generate a long term record of                        equatorial circulation and decipher the history of cyclic                       forcing. They will compare this with the record from the                        Pacific and other latitudes to test for climatic and                            oceanographic linkages. The study is an important avenue                        of investigation which will generate critical time series data                  for detailed paleoceanographic reconstructions of the                           equatorial  hydrological regime. It is also a natural extension                 of the PIs previous work that needs to be completed to its                      fruition.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE TRUSTEES OF COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY IN THE CITY OF NEW YORK
